numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that a legacy applicant is more likely to be admitted to an Ivy League school than a non-legacy applicant.
2. I noticed that this is true even if the legacy applicant does not have a higher parental income rank.
3. I noticed that many applicants with a parental income rank in the 80-85% range have a lower admission advantage if they are not legacy applicants.
4. I ask why an applicant with higher parental income and no legacy has a lower chance of admission.
5. I ask whether colleges want money from applicants.
6. I ask whether a legacy applicant with less money is admitted because of a scholarship.
7. I ask whether a legacy applicant with less money is admitted because of high academic performance.
8. I ask what the age gap is between an applicant and the applicant's relatives.
9. I ask whether colleges ask for the parental income of an applicant in the application.
10. This topic relates to me and my community.
11. I am a junior in high school.
12. I think that it is interesting to see what colleges look for in applicants.
13. I ask whether colleges look at the money of an applicant.
14. I ask whether colleges look at the academic performance of an applicant.
15. The headline is: College Applicants: You Cant be Too Rich.
